answers.q: how many valence electrons does nitrogen have
answers.a: Five; its outer shell configuration is 2s2 2p3.
The conversion of atmospheric N2 into ammonia or related biologically usable forms, mainly by certain microbes, lightning, or the industrial Haber-Bosch process.

As a food additive (E931), nitrogen is used as an inert packaging gas and for flushing/blanketing to prevent oxidation, for rapid freezing as liquid nitrogen, and to create fine bubbles in “nitro” beverages.
No—dinitrogen (N2) is not a greenhouse gas because it does not absorb infrared radiation; nitrous oxide (N2O) is a different compound that is a potent greenhouse gas.
The biogeochemical cycle moving nitrogen among the atmosphere, soils, waters, and organisms via fixation, nitrification, assimilation, ammonification, and denitrification.
